borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions:
The scale, siting and design of the proposed first floor rear extension and double storey side extension are considered harmful to the appearance of the house, built form of the terrace and character of the area, notably given the location of the application site within the Becontree Estate. As such, the proposed development is contrary to:

- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);
- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);
- Policy D4 of the Draft London Plan Intended to Publish (December 2019);
- Policies CP2 and CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010);
- Policies BP2, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);
- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);
- Policies SP4, DM11, DM14 and DM16 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 18 Consultation version, November 2019).

<div>The scale and siting of the proposed first floor rear extension would cause an unacceptable loss of daylight&nbsp; to neighbouring property No 15 Admore Road, therefore constituting unneighbourly development and contrary to:<br></div><div><br></div><div>- National Planning Policy Framework (MHCLG, February 2019);</div><div>- Policies 7.1, 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan (March 2016);</div><div>- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011);</div><div>- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);</div><div>- Policies DMD1 and DMD6 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Consultation version, October 2020).</div>
description: Construction of part single/part two storey rear and side extension.
